p: The obtained WWA from the local bakery was soaked in distilled water for 30 mins to remove unwanted particles floating on the surface of the sediment. The unwanted particles were removed by decantation, while the pure wetted waste wood ash (PWWWA) was obtained through filtration. The filtrate was discarded, and the residual PWWWA was oven-dried at 110 °C in an oven until a constant weight is achieved. The dried WWA was calcined in a programmable muffle furnace at 1100 °C for 3 h, the calcined waste wood ash (CWWA) was allowed to cool to room temperature for 48 h, before characterization.
